questions.question_text:
A customer with a legacy firewall architecture focused on port-and-protocol-level security has heard that NGFWs open all ports by default.

Which of the following statements regarding Palo Alto Networks NGFWs is an appropriate rebuttal that explains an advantage over legacy firewalls?

choices.B: They protect all applications on all ports while leaving all ports open by default.
choices.A: They do not consider port information, instead relying on App-ID signatures that do not reference ports.
choices.C: They can control applications by application-default service ports or a configurable list of approved ports on a per-policy basis.
choices.D: They keep ports closed by default, only opening after understanding the application request, and then opening only the application-specified ports.

questions.question_text: Which two configuration elements can be used to prevent abuse of stolen credentials? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
MFA is clear. Dynamic user groups provide valuable visibility and control over user activity, helping organizations detect and prevent the abuse of stolen credentials in real-time.

Selected Answer: AB
AB are correct

Selected Answer: AD
A&D. Yes, you enable Credential detection in an URL Filtering Profile but the question asks how to prevent the "abuse" of already stole credentials. MFA is clear. And you can use DUG to tag users where credentials already have been submitted and block them. Your thoughts?

Selected Answer: AB
Same type as Question Q21
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/palo-alto-networks/view/84155-exam-pse-strata-topic-1-question-21-discussion/

Selected Answer: AB
Correct answers are A and B. URL-F is mandatory to be enabled and MFA helps to ensure user authentication. WF analysis is focused on identifie unknown malware by inspecting files.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/url-filtering/prevent-credential-phishing

Selected Answer: AB
See explanation from homersimpson, it is A and B

Correct Answer is A & B
"To enable credential phishing prevention, you must configure both User-ID to detect when users submit valid corporate credentials to a site (as opposed to personal credentials) and URL Filtering to specify the URL categories in which you want to prevent users from entering their corporate credentials." 
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/url-filtering/prevent-credential-phishing
Correct A y B

A y C correct
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/url-filtering/prevent-credential-phishing
A y C correct

questions.question_text: What will a Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewall (NGFW) do when it is unable to retrieve a DNS verdict from the DNS cloud service in the configured lookup time?

choices.D: discard the request and all subsequent responses
choices.B: allow the request and all subsequent responses
choices.C: temporarily disable the DNS Security function
